Main effects within conditions (function)
Just RR. 

This plot is not used in the paper as it is very messy 
(multiple distributions) & also the populations don't differ much. 

```{r}

#raincloud plot

RR_FUN <- function(.df, .xvar, .strat, .colab, .net1, .net2){
  
  xvar <- enquo(.xvar)
  strat <- enquo(.strat)
  colab <- enquo(.colab)
  net1 <- enquo(.net1)
  net2 <- enquo(.net2)
  
g <- .df %>%
  filter(strategy == UQ(strat),
         colab_cond == UQ(colab),
         network == UQ(net1) | network == UQ(net2)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = UQ(xvar), 
             y = RR, fill = UQ(xvar))) +
  geom_flat_violin(position = position_nudge(x = .2, y = 0), alpha = .8) +
  geom_point(aes(y = RR, color = UQ(xvar)), 
                  position = position_jitter(width = .15), 
                  size = .5, alpha = 0.8) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .1, outlier.shape = NA, alpha = 0.5) +
  expand_limits(x = 3) +
  guides(fill = FALSE) + 
  guides(color = FALSE) +
  scale_fill_tableau() +
  scale_color_tableau() +
  #coord_flip() +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(x = "Populations", 
       y = "Replication Rate", 
       color = "Proportion of different models", 
       title = "Replication rate",
       subtitle = paste0("Networks: ", quo_name(net1), " & ",
                         quo_name(net2), " | ",
                         "Colab: ", quo_name(colab))) +
  raincloud_theme

#call the plot
g

}


```

RR & TAT (prep).
Again, we don't use this in the paper. 
It is quite messy without grouping over true models,
however, it does give a clear picture. 
We prefer to group by true models as well to
make it more clear. 

```{r}
setwd("~/CRUST-1/MetascienceBA/data/dataPlotting")
RR <- read_csv("violin_ridges_RR_MetascienceBA.csv")

#prep TF. 
RR <- RR %>%
  mutate(network = factor(network),
        population = factor(population),
        sigma = factor(sigma),
        colab_cond = factor(colab_cond),
        net_size = factor(net_size),
        true_model = factor(true_model),
        colab_cond = recode(colab_cond,
                               NOLAB = "No",
                               COLAB = "Yes"))

#by conditions 
RR_SUB <- RR %>%
  filter(!((network == "PT" | network == "TOM") & colab_cond == "No")) %>%
  mutate(condition = ifelse((network == "Lattice" |
                            network == "Small") &
                            colab_cond == "No", 
                            "Small & Lattice, Colab: No",
                            ifelse((network == "Lattice" |
                                   network == "Small") &
                                   colab_cond == "Yes", 
                                   "Small & Lattice, Colab: Yes",
                                   "Citation Networks, Colab: Yes")),
         condition = factor(condition))

#melting
melt_RR_TAT <- melt(RR_SUB, 
                    id.vars = c("replica", "population",
                                "sigma", "true_model", 
                                "colab_cond", "condition"), 
                    measure.vars = c("RR", "TAT"), 
                    variable.name = "variable", 
                    value.name = "proportion")
```

The same with Ridges

```{r}

RR_FUN <- function(.df, .var1, .sigma, .net1, .net2, .colab){
  
  var1 <- enquo(.var1)
  sigma <- enquo(.sigma)
  net1 <- enquo(.net1)
  net2 <- enquo(.net2)
  colab <- enquo(.colab)

  g <- .df %>%
      filter(sigma == UQ(sigma),
         colab_cond == UQ(colab),
         network == UQ(net1) | network == UQ(net2)) %>%
      ggplot(aes(x = proportion,
                 y = UQ(var1), 
                 color = variable,
                 fill = variable)) +
      geom_density_ridges(jittered_points = TRUE, scale = 0.8, 
                          rel_min_height = .01,
                          point_shape = "|", point_size = 3, size = 0.25, 
                          position = position_points_jitter(height = 0)) +
      scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)) +
      scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0,0), 
                         name = "Replication rate & time at true model") +
      scale_fill_manual(values = c("#D55E0050", "#0072B250"), 
                        labels = c("Replication rate", "Time at true model")) +
      scale_color_manual(values = c("#D55E00", "#0072B2"), guide = "none") +
      scale_discrete_manual("point_color", values = c("#D55E00", "#0072B2"), 
                            guide = "none") +
      guides(fill = guide_legend("",
        override.aes = list(
        fill = c("#D55E00A0", "#0072B2A0"),
        color = NA, point_color = NA))
      ) +
      theme_ridges(center = TRUE) + 
      theme_janco_point() 
      
    g + labs(caption = "Sample size: 100. 'Replication rate' and 'proportion of time at the true model' both on the x-axis. \n Density curves are averaged over sigma-levels, true models and replicas. \n Lines at the bottom represent mean values for individual replicas") +
      theme(plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
}

RR_FUN(melt_RR_TAT, true_model, 0.5, "Small", "Lattice", "Yes")
```

```{r}
    geom_flat_violin(position = position_nudge(x = .2, y = 0), alpha = .7) +
    geom_point(aes(y = RR, color = UQ(var2)), 
                    position = position_jitter(width = .15), 
                    size = .5, alpha = 0.8) +
    geom_boxplot(width = .1, outlier.shape = NA, alpha = 0.5) +
    expand_limits(x = 2) + #not clear that this changes much. 
    #guides(fill = FALSE) + #legend can be deleted. 
    guides(color = FALSE) +
    scale_fill_tableau() +
    scale_color_tableau() +
    coord_flip() +
    theme_bw() +
    labs(title = paste0("Replication rate for ", as_label(var1), "s"),
         subtitle = paste0("Grouped by ", as_label(var2)), 
         x = paste0(as_label(var1)), 
         y = "Replication rate",
         fill = paste0(as_label(var2))) + #sets the legend title.
    raincloud_theme
  
  #call the plot
  g

}

RR_FUN4(df_RR, population, true_model) #no real effect.

#sigma vs. everything

RR_FUN4(df_RR, sigma, population) #big Tess & Bo effects (unsurprisingly)
RR_FUN4(df_RR, sigma, true_model) #interaction effect for sure. 
RR_FUN4(df_RR, sigma, colab_cond) #nothing. 

#true model vs. everything

RR_FUN4(df_RR, true_model, network) #least action/change/diff in TOM
RR_FUN4(df_RR, true_model, sigma) #interaction effect (same as before)
RR_FUN4(df_RR, true_model, colab_cond) #nothing
```
